critique: The document describes a situation where a widow and her two daughters are left without sufficient means of support after the death of her husband. The President is signing an order to appoint the widow to a position in the Bureau of Engraving and Printing. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is joy that the widow and her daughters will now have sufficient means of support. The President also wants to elicit sadness for the loss of the husband and father. The President also wants to elicit surprise that the President is taking action to help the widow and her daughters. The President does not want to elicit anger, fear, or disgust.
